title: South Africa's Tongaat mulls sale of assets, rights issue
text:
Power lines supplying electricity by stated owned Eskom run through sugar cane fields on a Tongaat Hulett farm in Shongweni, South Africa April 29, 2018. REUTERS/Rogan Ward

JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - South African sugar producer Tongaat Hulett said on Monday it is considering the possible sale of assets, a possible equity capital raise or a combination thereof in order to reduce the group’s debt.

Tongaat, which said in April it would restate financial information after a formal review revealed certain accounting practices that needed to be re-examined, also said debt restructuring talks with South African and Mozambican debt providers are progressing well.
